p: When advertising the studies (with a reward of $100 for Study 1 and $150 for Study 2) we hid the climate crisis content to attract a neutral (and generalizable) student audience rather than a self-selecting audience already interested in climate action. For Study 2 the payment was increased to $150 because few students were signing up, probably due to pandemic conditions. The informal debriefing for Study 2 strongly indicated that participants were short of money and time and expected payment to join the activist events.
